meanings.definition: The act of making something black.
meanings.sent1: The blackenings of the charcoal were evident on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The blackenings on the stove were caused by the fire.
meanings.sent3: The blackenings on the toast made it look like a tiny piece of night sky.
meanings.sent4: The blackenings on the metal gate gave it a mysterious aura.
meanings.sent5: The blackenings of the ink on the page were so deep, they seemed to absorb all light.

meanings.definition: The result of something becoming black.
meanings.sent1: The blackenings of the fabric were due to the dye used.
meanings.sent2: The blackenings on the wall indicated a fire had occurred.
meanings.sent3: The blackenings on the banana peel made it look like a tiny burnt tree.
meanings.sent4: The blackenings on the sky at night were like a blanket of darkness.
meanings.sent5: The blackenings of the coal were a testament to its burning intensity.

meanings.sent1: The blackenings of the wood were caused by exposure to the elements.
meanings.sent2: The blackenings on the metal were a sign of corrosion.
meanings.sent3: The blackenings on the snow made it seem like a canvas waiting for color.
meanings.sent4: The blackenings on the horizon signaled the coming of night.
meanings.sent5: The blackenings of the sky during a storm were ominous and foreboding.
